channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8349039] Adjust exception No type named <ThreadType> in database
item.description:
We should change the exception message from
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: No type named "DeoptimizeObjectsALotThread" in database
to
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: No type named "DeoptimizeObjectsALotThread" in hotspot type database

error was (from JDK-8348800) :
serviceability/sa/CDSJMapClstats.java

at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.runtime.Threads.createJavaThreadWrapper(Threads.java:196)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.runtime.Threads.getJavaThreadAt(Threads.java:178)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.oops.ObjectHeap.collectLiveRegions(ObjectHeap.java:320)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.oops.ObjectHeap.iterateSubtypes(ObjectHeap.java:216)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.oops.ObjectHeap.iterateObjectsOfKlass(ObjectHeap.java:116)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.oops.ObjectHeap.iterateObjectsOfKlass(ObjectHeap.java:128)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.tools.ClassLoaderStats.printClassLoaderStatistics(ClassLoaderStats.java:95)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.tools.ClassLoaderStats.run(ClassLoaderStats.java:78)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.tools.JMap.run(JMap.java:121)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.tools.Tool.startInternal(Tool.java:278)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.tools.Tool.start(Tool.java:241)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.tools.Tool.execute(Tool.java:134)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.tools.JMap.main(JMap.java:202)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.SALauncher.runJMAP(SALauncher.java:344)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.SALauncher.main(SALauncher.java:507)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: No type named "DeoptimizeObjectsALotThread" in database
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.types.basic.BasicTypeDataBase.lookupType(BasicTypeDataBase.java:86)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.HotSpotTypeDataBase.lookupType(HotSpotTypeDataBase.java:137)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.types.basic.BasicTypeDataBase.lookupType(BasicTypeDataBase.java:80)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.runtime.VirtualConstructor.instantiateWrapperFor(VirtualConstructor.java:75)
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.runtime.Threads.createJavaThreadWrapper(Threads.java:192)
item.summary: Adjust exception No type named <ThreadType> in database

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

Changeset: 669f8c0c
Branch: master
Author: Matthias Baesken <mbaesken@openjdk.org>
Date: 2025-01-31 08:11:30 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/669f8c0c07b57fa00ac84b8a90c4a1a1459443e3

> OK thanks for clarifying. Here in the JBS issue you've written "in hotspot type database" which looks like all new wording, as the existing wording is (mostly) "present in type database".

Yeah true; my first idea was to write "hotspot type database" but later when doing the PR I noticed that there is already existing wording so I decided to keep the existing wording and make it consistent.

OK thanks for clarifying. Here in the JBS issue you've written "in hotspot type database" which looks like all new wording, as the existing wording is (mostly) "present in type database". If we have one line that is different to others then I agree with the update. 8-)

> An Exception raised from jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot... mentions a database. We don't spell out in the message that it's the HotSpot Type Database.

Hi Kevin [~kevinw] please check the PR and also the coding below the changed line . In lookupIntConstant and lookupLongConstant we say "present in type database" and I think this is better and should be the same/consistent in this 3rd message too.
Probably 'hotspot' should not be added (keep the messages similar) , so I say just 'type database' and not 'hotspot type database' .

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/23365
Date: 2025-01-30 10:22:17 +0000

I just want to delicately raise the question of if this is worth doing, and if it's a good thing to do (there can no doubt be good reasons for changing these messages).

An Exception raised from jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot... mentions a database. We don't spell out in the message that it's the HotSpot Type Database. But that is an internal detail of SA, casual users aren't expected to be here, and its not clear Tool users are better off with the message change.

An Exception message that has been around for... many years... is almost an interface. We don't have the same rules exactly, but should have some stability.
